pageContext.description: In excellent condition.  Both faces, from slight ridge at centre to secondary grinding surface show slight rippling.  8 ripples are visible on the less patinated face.  Flange faces show similar rippling in three sections.
pageContext.patina: One face very slight, partly lustrous; the other a rich chocolate brown
pageContext.associations: With 6743/1, /3, /4   Flanged axe, wing flanged axe, side looped spearhead
pageContext.publications: Trans. Woolhope Naturalists' Field Club, 1947, pp. xlv - xlix, and photograph (L.F. Chitty)
pageContext.collection: Hereford Museum and Art Gallery Acc. No. 6743/2,  Donor: Mr. R.A. Smith, Netherwood Manor, Tenbury Wells, Worcestershire
pageContext.site: herefordshire, thornbury, netherwood, this provenance is extremely dubious
